name: argocd
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing argocd cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`argocd` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/oboukili/terraform-provider-argocd).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing argocd cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/oboukili/terraform-provider-argocd)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-argocd` repo](https://github.com/minds/argocd-pulumi/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-argocd` repo](https://github.com/oboukili/terraform-provider-argocd/issues).

authToken.description:
ArgoCD authentication token, takes precedence over `username`/`password`. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_TOKEN`
environment variable.

certFile.description: Additional root CA certificates file to add to the client TLS connection pool.

configPath.description:
Override the default config path of `$HOME/.config/argocd/config`. Only relevant when `use_local_config`. Can be set
through the `ARGOCD_CONFIG_PATH` environment variable.

context.description:
Context to choose when using a local ArgoCD config file. Only relevant when `use_local_config`. Can be set through
`ARGOCD_CONTEXT` environment variable.

core.description:
Configure direct access using Kubernetes API server. **Warning**: this feature works by starting a local ArgoCD API
server that talks directly to the Kubernetes API using the **current context in the default kubeconfig**
(`~/.kube/config`). This behavior cannot be overridden using either environment variables or the `kubernetes` block in
the provider configuration at present). If the server fails to start (e.g. your kubeconfig is misconfigured) then the
provider will fail as a result of the `argocd` module forcing it to exit and no logs will be available to help you debug
this. The error message will be similar to > `The plugin encountered an error, and failed to respond to the
plugin.(*GRPCProvider).ReadResource call. The plugin logs may contain more details.` To debug this, you will need to
login via the ArgoCD CLI using `argocd login --core` and then running an operation. E.g. `argocd app list`.

grpcWeb.description: Whether to use gRPC web proxy client. Useful if Argo CD server is behind proxy which does not support HTTP2.

grpcWebRootPath.description:
Use the gRPC web proxy client and set the web root, e.g. `argo-cd`. Useful if the Argo CD server is behind a proxy at a
non-root path.

headers.description: Additional headers to add to each request to the ArgoCD server.

insecure.description: Whether to skip TLS server certificate. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_INSECURE` environment variable.

kubernetes.description:
Kubernetes configuration overrides. Only relevant when `port_forward = true` or `port_forward_with_namespace = "foo"`.
The kubeconfig file that is used can be overridden using the [`KUBECONFIG` environment
variable](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/#the-kubeconfig-environment-variable)).

password.description: Authentication password. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_PASSWORD` environment variable.

plainText.description: Whether to initiate an unencrypted connection to ArgoCD server.

portForward.description: Connect to a random argocd-server port using port forwarding.

portForwardWithNamespace.description: Namespace name which should be used for port forwarding.

serverAddr.description: ArgoCD server address with port. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_SERVER` environment variable.

useLocalConfig.description:
Use the authentication settings found in the local config file. Useful when you have previously logged in using SSO.
Conflicts with `auth_token`, `username` and `password`.

username.description: Authentication username. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_USERNAME` environment variable.

clientCertificate.description: PEM-encoded client certificate for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLIENT_CERT_DATA`.

clientKey.description: PEM-encoded client certificate key for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLIENT_KEY_DATA`.

clusterCaCertificate.description: PEM-encoded root certificates bundle for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLUSTER_CA_CERT_DATA`.

configContext.description: Context to choose from the config file. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CTX`.

exec.description: Configuration block to use an [exec-based credential plugin](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/authentication/#client-go-credential-plugins), e.g. call an external command to receive user credentials.

host.description: The hostname (in form of URI) of the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_HOST`.

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate. Can be sourced from `KUBE_INSECURE`.

password.description: The password to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_PASSWORD`.

token.description: Token to authenticate an service account. Can be sourced from `KUBE_TOKEN`.

username.description: The username to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_USER`.

apiVersion.description: API version to use when decoding the ExecCredentials resource, e.g. `client.authentication.k8s.io/v1beta1`.

args.description: Map of environment variables to set when executing the plugin.

env.description: List of arguments to pass when executing the plugin.

generation.description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applications.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: Name of the applications.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the applications.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

resourceVersion.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this applications.argoproj.io that can be used by clients to determine when applications.argoproj.io has changed. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

generators.description: Application set generators. Generators are responsible for generating parameters, which are then rendered into the template: fields of the ApplicationSet resource.

template.description: Application set template. The template fields of the ApplicationSet spec are used to generate Argo CD Application resources.

clusterDecisionResources.description: The [cluster decision resource](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster-Decision-Resource/) generates a list of Argo CD clusters.

clusters.description: The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

gits.description: [Git generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Git/) generates parameters using either the directory structure of a specified Git repository (directory generator), or, using the contents of JSON/YAML files found within a specified repository (file generator).

lists.description: [List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

matrices.description: [Matrix generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/) combine the parameters generated by two child generators, iterating through every combination of each generator's generated parameters. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting matrix generators.

merges.description: [Merge generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Merge/) combine parameters produced by the base (first) generator with matching parameter sets produced by subsequent generators. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Merge/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting merge generators.

pullRequests.description: [Pull Request generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Pull-Request/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover open pull requests within a repository.

scmProviders.description: [SCM Provider generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-SCM-Provider/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover repositories within an organization.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

enabled.description: Boolean value defaulting to `true` to indicate that this block has been added thereby allowing all other attributes to be optional.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

configMapRef.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

labelSelector.description: Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

requeueAfterSeconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

targetRevision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

ignoreMissingValueFiles.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

parameters.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.

passCredentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

releaseName.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skipCrds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

valueFiles.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

forceString.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

automated.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

allowEmpty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

files.description: List of files in the source repository to use when template the Application.

pathParamPrefix.description: Prefix for all path-related parameter names.

repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

revision.description: Revision of the source repository to use.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

generators.description: Application set generators. Generators are responsible for generating parameters, which are then rendered into the template: fields of the ApplicationSet resource.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

clusterDecisionResources.description: The [cluster decision resource](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster-Decision-Resource/) generates a list of Argo CD clusters.

clusters.description: The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

gits.description: [Git generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Git/) generates parameters using either the directory structure of a specified Git repository (directory generator), or, using the contents of JSON/YAML files found within a specified repository (file generator).

lists.description: [List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

matrices.description: [Matrix generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/) combine the parameters generated by two child generators, iterating through every combination of each generator's generated parameters. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting matrix generators.

merges.description: [Merge generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Merge/) combine parameters produced by the base (first) generator with matching parameter sets produced by subsequent generators. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Merge/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting merge generators.

pullRequests.description: [Pull Request generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Pull-Request/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover open pull requests within a repository.

scmProviders.description: [SCM Provider generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-SCM-Provider/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover repositories within an organization.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

enabled.description: Boolean value defaulting to `true` to indicate that this block has been added thereby allowing all other attributes to be optional.

labelSelector.description: Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.

commonLabels.description: List of additional labels to add to rendered manifests.

images.description: List of Kustomize image override specifications.

namePrefix.description: Prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

nameSuffix.description: Suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

automated.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

managedNamespaceMetadata.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

syncOptions.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allowEmpty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

metadata.description: Kubernetes object metadata for templated Application.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

finalizers.description: List of finalizers to apply to the resulting Application.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

targetRevision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

clusters.description: The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

gits.description: [Git generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Git/) generates parameters using either the directory structure of a specified Git repository (directory generator), or, using the contents of JSON/YAML files found within a specified repository (file generator).

lists.description: [List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

pullRequests.description: [Pull Request generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Pull-Request/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover open pull requests within a repository.

scmProviders.description: [SCM Provider generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-SCM-Provider/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover repositories within an organization.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

enabled.description: Boolean value defaulting to `true` to indicate that this block has been added thereby allowing all other attributes to be optional.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

configMapRef.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

labelSelector.description: Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

requeueAfterSeconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

metadata.description: Kubernetes object metadata for templated Application.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

finalizers.description: List of finalizers to apply to the resulting Application.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

sources.description: Location of the application's manifests or chart.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jqPathExpressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

jsonPointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

targetRevision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

fileParameters.description: File parameters for the helm template.

ignoreMissingValueFiles.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

parameters.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.

passCredentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

releaseName.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skipCrds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

valueFiles.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

forceString.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names
Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

automated.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

managedNamespaceMetadata.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

syncOptions.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allowEmpty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

metadata.description: Kubernetes object metadata for templated Application.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

finalizers.description: List of finalizers to apply to the resulting Application.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

sources.description: Location of the application's manifests or chart.

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

targetRevision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

releaseName.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skipCrds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

valueFiles.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

generators.description: Application set generators. Generators are responsible for generating parameters, which are then rendered into the template: fields of the ApplicationSet resource.

mergeKeys.description: Keys to merge into resulting parameter set.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

clusterDecisionResources.description: The [cluster decision resource](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster-Decision-Resource/) generates a list of Argo CD clusters.

clusters.description: The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

gits.description: [Git generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Git/) generates parameters using either the directory structure of a specified Git repository (directory generator), or, using the contents of JSON/YAML files found within a specified repository (file generator).

lists.description: [List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

pullRequests.description: [Pull Request generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Pull-Request/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover open pull requests within a repository.

scmProviders.description: [SCM Provider generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-SCM-Provider/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover repositories within an organization.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

enabled.description: Boolean value defaulting to `true` to indicate that this block has been added thereby allowing all other attributes to be optional.

automated.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

managedNamespaceMetadata.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

syncOptions.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allowEmpty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

azureDevops.description: Uses the Azure DevOps API to look up eligible repositories based on a team project within an Azure DevOps organization.

bitbucketCloud.description: Uses the Bitbucket API V2 to scan a workspace in bitbucket.org.

bitbucketServer.description: Fetch pull requests from a repo hosted on a Bitbucket Server.

cloneProtocol.description: Which protocol to use for the SCM URL. Default is provider-specific but ssh if possible. Not all providers necessarily support all protocols.

filters.description: Filters allow selecting which pull requests to generate for.

gitea.description: Specify the repository from which to fetch the Gitea Pull requests.

github.description: Specify the repository from which to fetch the GitHub Pull requests.

gitlab.description: Specify the project from which to fetch the GitLab merge requests.

requeueAfterSeconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

accessTokenRef.description: The Personal Access Token (PAT) to use when connecting.

allBranches.description: Scan all branches instead of just the default branch.

api.description: The Bitbucket REST API URL to talk to e.g. https://bitbucket.org/rest.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

allBranches.description: Scan all branches instead of just the default branch.

appPasswordRef.description: The app password to use for the user. See: https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/app-passwords/.

owner.description: Gitea org or user to scan.

user.description: Bitbucket user to use when authenticating. Should have a "member" role to be able to read all repositories and branches.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

allBranches.description: Scan all branches instead of just the default branch.

api.description: The Bitbucket REST API URL to talk to e.g. https://bitbucket.org/rest.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

branchMatch.description: A regex which must match the branch name.

labelMatch.description: A regex which must match at least one label.

pathsDoNotExists.description: An array of paths, all of which must not exist.

pathsExists.description: An array of paths, all of which must exist.

allBranches.description: Scan all branches instead of just the default branch.

api.description: The Bitbucket REST API URL to talk to e.g. https://bitbucket.org/rest.

insecure.description: Allow insecure tls, for self-signed certificates; default: false.

finalizers.description: List of finalizers to apply to the resulting Application.

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

targetRevision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

fileParameters.description: File parameters for the helm template.

ignoreMissingValueFiles.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

parameters.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.

passCredentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

releaseName.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skipCrds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

valueFiles.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

forceString.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

passCredentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

releaseName.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skipCrds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

valueFiles.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

forceString.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

automated.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

managedNamespaceMetadata.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

syncOptions.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allowEmpty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

azureDevops.description: Uses the Azure DevOps API to look up eligible repositories based on a team project within an Azure DevOps organization.

bitbucketCloud.description: Uses the Bitbucket API V2 to scan a workspace in bitbucket.org.

bitbucketServer.description: Fetch pull requests from a repo hosted on a Bitbucket Server.

cloneProtocol.description: Which protocol to use for the SCM URL. Default is provider-specific but ssh if possible. Not all providers necessarily support all protocols.

filters.description: Filters allow selecting which pull requests to generate for.

gitea.description: Specify the repository from which to fetch the Gitea Pull requests.

github.description: Specify the repository from which to fetch the GitHub Pull requests.

gitlab.description: Specify the project from which to fetch the GitLab merge requests.

generators.description: Application set generators. Generators are responsible for generating parameters, which are then rendered into the template: fields of the ApplicationSet resource.

mergeKeys.description: Keys to merge into resulting parameter set.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

clusterDecisionResources.description: The [cluster decision resource](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster-Decision-Resource/) generates a list of Argo CD clusters.

clusters.description: The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

gits.description: [Git generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Git/) generates parameters using either the directory structure of a specified Git repository (directory generator), or, using the contents of JSON/YAML files found within a specified repository (file generator).

lists.description: [List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

matrices.description: [Matrix generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/) combine the parameters generated by two child generators, iterating through every combination of each generator's generated parameters. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Matrix/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting matrix generators.

merges.description: [Merge generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Merge/) combine parameters produced by the base (first) generator with matching parameter sets produced by subsequent generators. Take note of the [restrictions](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Merge/#restrictions) regarding their usage - particularly regarding nesting merge generators.

pullRequests.description: [Pull Request generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Pull-Request/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover open pull requests within a repository.

scmProviders.description: [SCM Provider generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-SCM-Provider/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover repositories within an organization.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

enabled.description: Boolean value defaulting to `true` to indicate that this block has been added thereby allowing all other attributes to be optional.

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

targetRevision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

allowEmpty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

targetRevision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

fileParameters.description: File parameters for the helm template.

ignoreMissingValueFiles.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

parameters.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.

passCredentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

releaseName.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skipCrds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

valueFiles.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

forceString.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

commonAnnotations.description: List of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests.

commonLabels.description: List of additional labels to add to rendered manifests.

images.description: List of Kustomize image override specifications.

namePrefix.description: Prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

nameSuffix.description: Suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

version.description: Version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests.

envs.description: Environment variables passed to the plugin.

Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

automated.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

managedNamespaceMetadata.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

syncOptions.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allowEmpty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applicationsets.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applicationsets.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

generators.description: Application set generators. Generators are responsible for generating parameters, which are then rendered into the template: fields of the ApplicationSet resource.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

clusterDecisionResources.description: The [cluster decision resource](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster-Decision-Resource/) generates a list of Argo CD clusters.

clusters.description: The [cluster generator](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Cluster/) produces parameters based on the list of items found within the cluster secret.

gits.description: [Git generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Git/) generates parameters using either the directory structure of a specified Git repository (directory generator), or, using the contents of JSON/YAML files found within a specified repository (file generator).

lists.description: [List generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-List/) generate parameters based on an arbitrary list of key/value pairs (as long as the values are string values).

pullRequests.description: [Pull Request generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-Pull-Request/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover open pull requests within a repository.

scmProviders.description: [SCM Provider generators](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/applicationset/Generators-SCM-Provider/) uses the API of an SCMaaS provider to automatically discover repositories within an organization.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

enabled.description: Boolean value defaulting to `true` to indicate that this block has been added thereby allowing all other attributes to be optional.

selector.description: Label selector used to narrow the scope of targeted clusters.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

configMapRef.description: ConfigMap with the duck type definitions needed to retrieve the data this includes apiVersion(group/version), kind, matchKey and validation settings.

labelSelector.description: Label selector used to find the resource defined in the `config_map_ref`. Alternative to `name`.

name.description: Name of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

requeueAfterSeconds.description: How often to check for changes (in seconds). Default: 3min.

template.description: Generator template. Used to override the values of the spec-level template.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

namespace.description: Namespace of the applicationsets.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.
